body:
> To put it simply, we no longer have kings anointed by God

I am not aware of any king of this world being "anointed by God" aside from their own claims. The only exception is the first couple of Israel/Judah kings in response to the peoples' relentless demanding for one, and even they were failures.

> Then, Christianity created the Christian family. We must protect the concept of the Christian family.

According to whom? The popular radio-show hosts and televangelists? Women who want their husbands to hand everything to them? Men who have fetishes for dominating women? Those whose goal it is to pop out as many babies as possible for supremacy? Certainly not Jesus, who said, "If anyone comes to me and does not love less his father and mother and children and brothers and sisters and even his own life, he is not able to be my follower" and "Don't call anyone on earth 'father' because you have one father, who is of heaven".

> Our fundamental position on the issue of immigration is that it is an ontologically bad thing.

> even if someone were to leave their homeland, the goal should be to return later on.

Do we have the same book? Because mine says, "There shall be one law for you [Israel], it shall be for the foreigner as the native. If a foreigner resides with you in your land, you shall not mistreat them; the foreigner who lives with you is to be to you as one born of you, and you are to love them as yourself, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt. I am 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 your god".
body_html:
To put it simply, we no longer have kings anointed by God

I am not aware of any king of this world being "anointed by God" aside from their own claims. The only exception is the first couple of Israel/Judah kings in response to the peoples' relentless demanding for one, and even they were failures.

Then, Christianity created the Christian family. We must protect the concept of the Christian family.

According to whom? The popular radio-show hosts and televangelists? Women who want their husbands to hand everything to them? Men who have fetishes for dominating women? Those whose goal it is to pop out as many babies as possible for supremacy? Certainly not Jesus, who said, "If anyone comes to me and does not love less his father and mother and children and brothers and sisters and even his own life, he is not able to be my follower" and "Don't call anyone on earth 'father' because you have one father, who is of heaven".

Our fundamental position on the issue of immigration is that it is an ontologically bad thing.

even if someone were to leave their homeland, the goal should be to return later on.

Do we have the same book? Because mine says, "There shall be one law for you [Israel], it shall be for the foreigner as the native. If a foreigner resides with you in your land, you shall not mistreat them; the foreigner who lives with you is to be to you as one born of you, and you are to love them as yourself, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt. I am 𐤉𐤄𐤅𐤄 your god".

guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body: The nuclear family is a failure. Bring back the extended family.
body_html: The nuclear family is a failure. Bring back the extended family.
